Detect Supported Time Resolutions for ESIOS Indicators

Source: R/esios2resolution.R
esios2resolution.Rd

Adds binary flags to an ESIOS indicators metadata data.frame denoting whether each indicator supports various time-series resolutions. Supported resolutions include: 1 minute, 5 minutes, 10 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 1 hour, 4 hours, and 1 day. The function samples a specified date (default: yesterday) and queries the ESIOS API to inspect actual timestamp intervals.

Usage

esios2resolution(
  indicators = NULL,
  api_key,
  encoding = "UTF-8",
  check_date = NULL,
  verbose = FALSE,
  csv_file = NULL
)

Arguments

indicators

A data.frame as returned by esios2indicators(). If NULL, the full indicator catalog will be fetched automatically.

api_key

String: your personal ESIOS API key.

encoding

Character: JSON encoding for API responses (default: "UTF-8").

check_date

Date or string "YYYY-MM-DD" used for sampling; defaults to Sys.Date() - 1.

verbose

Logical; if TRUE, progress messages are printed.

csv_file

Optional string path: if provided, writes the annotated metadata to this CSV file (directories are created as needed).

Value

The input indicators data.frame extended with integer columns res1min, res5min, res10min, res15min, res30min, res1hour, res4hour, and res1day, each set to 1 if the indicator supports that resolution, or 0 otherwise.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Annotate only Wind_551
api_key <- Sys.getenv("ESIOS_API_KEY")
inds <- esios2indicators(api_key, output_dir = "data_indicators")
res  <- esios2resolution(
  indicators = inds[inds$short_name_en == "Wind_551", ],
  api_key     = api_key,
  verbose     = TRUE
)
print(res[, c("short_name_en", "res5min", "res10min", "res1hour")])
} # }
